alert.note: Alert for Hale; Hockley; Lamb; Lubbock (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 25 at 12:56AM CDT until May 25 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Texas, including the following counties, Hale, Hockley, Lamb and Lubbock. * WHEN...Until 300 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1254 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area as thunderstorms slowly move south. - Widespread rainfall rates of 2-3 inches per hour can be expected with isolated areas seeing 3-4 inches per hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lubbock, Littlefield, Wolfforth, Shallowater, Anton, Amherst, Whitharral, Spade, Reese Center, Fieldton, Lubbock South Plains Mall, Slide, Smyer, Ropesville and Opdyke West. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
